meta_description: It's a new kind of museum—and a whole new way to experience our world.
hours_text:
#  Hours & Admissions

Photo: Rachel Ormiston/Burke Museum

Photo: Rachel Ormiston/Burke Museum

## We can't wait to see you!

With working labs you can see into, one-of-a-kind objects all around you, and galleries filled with curiosity and conversation, at the Burke, you see — and feel — a world alive. The Burke Museum is located on the University of Washington campus in Seattle with a focus on dinosaurs, fossils, Northwest Native art, plant and animal collections, and cultural pieces from across the globe. 

**View or download the Burke Museum floor guide:**

###### **Mobile view floor guide**

[English](/sites/default/files/2025-04/Burke_Floor_Guide%201.pdf)

###### **Printable floor guide**

[English](/sites/default/files/2025-04/Burke_Floor_Guide.pdf)

[Español](/sites/default/files/2025-04/Burke_Guía_de_Niveles.pdf)

  * [Accessibility](/visit/accessibility)
  * [Burke Store](/burke-store)
  * [Off the Rez Café](https://www.offthereztruck.com/)

## Hours

Tuesday – Sunday: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m.  
Last admission at 4:30 p.m.

First Thursday of each month: 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.

Monday: CLOSED

### Closures

January 1 | New Year's Day: Closed  
April 11 | Private Event: Closed  
July 4 | Independence Day: Closed  
November 26 | Thanksgiving: Closed  
December 24 | Christmas Eve: Closed  
December 25 | Christmas: Closed

admission_text:
#  Tickets

Photo: Rachel Ormiston/Burke Museum

Photo: Rachel Ormiston/Burke Museum

## We can't wait to see you!

With working labs you can see into, one-of-a-kind objects all around you, and galleries filled with curiosity and conversation, at the Burke, you see—and feel—a world alive. The Burke Museum is located on the University of Washington campus in Seattle with a focus on dinosaurs, fossils, Northwest Native art, plant and animal collections, and cultural pieces from across the globe. 

### **Save time, get tickets online**

Pre-purchased, online tickets are encouraged. A limited number of walk-up tickets are available on a first come, first-served basis as space allows. Book your ticket in advance to visit at your ideal time and skip the line on busy days like weekends and Free First Thursdays! **You may arrive at any time during the hour of your reserved time slot and stay for as long as you'd like.**

Menu

  * [Get Tickets](/tickets)
  * [Discounts](/visit/discounts)

## Date

When would you like to visit? Please select a date from the calendar.

## Entry Time

Museum hours are 10 AM – 5 PM Tuesday–Sunday. The BUY TICKETS button will appear once you select your desired entry time.

[](javascript:; "Advance timed tickets are required for entry and are offered every 60 minutes throughout the day. You can arrive any time during the hour of your reserved time slot. There is a lot to see and do at the Burke Museum, so we suggest allowing between 1 1/2 and 2 hours to m...
accessibility_text:
#  Accessibility

Photo: Cathy Morris/Burke Museum

Photo: Cathy Morris/Burke Museum

### The Burke Museum welcomes people of all abilities.

All galleries, restrooms, and museum spaces are designed in accordance with ADA specifications. Our visitor services team is happy to provide the following amenities on a first-come, first-served basis:

  * Wheelchairs
  * Folding cane seats
  * Visors and noise-reducing earmuffs 
  * Fidget wristbands 

The University of Washington is committed to providing access, and reasonable accommodation in its services, programs, activities, education, and employment for individuals with disabilities. To request accommodation during your visit please contact our Visitor Services team at [burkevis@uw.edu](mailto:burkevis@uw.edu) or 206.616.8616.

**Caregivers receive free admission**. If you are a caregiver for a person with a disability, please let admission staff know during your visit.

**Service animals are welcome in the Burke**. Companion animals do not qualify as service animals and are not allowed in the museum. As other animals are not allowed in the building, you may be asked if you have a service animal upon entry.

**NEW[Archaeology Gallery Accessibility Tools](/visit/accessibility/archaeology-gallery-accessibility-tools) pilot program. **We're excited to launch accessibility tools for use in the _Our Material World_ gallery. 

[Learn more](/visit/accessibility/archaeology-gallery-accessibility-tools)

collections_text:
# Welcome

## One museum.  
Millions of stories.

### Every day is different at  
the Burke Museum!

[Tickets](/tickets)

## 

### Hours

Tuesday – Sunday: 10 AM – 5 PM  
Last admission at 4:30 PM

First Thursday of each month: 10 AM – 8 PM

Monday: CLOSED

### Location

4303 Memorial Way NE  
Seattle, WA, United States

[Directions & Parking](/visit/directions-and-parking)

### Admission

Book your ticket in advance to visit at your ideal time and skip the line on busy days like weekends and Free First Thursdays! 

**You may arrive at any time during the hour of your reserved time slot.**

[Tickets](/tickets)

##  Special exhibition now open! 

### Woven in Wool: Resilience in Coast Salish Weaving

****_Woven in Wool: Resilience in Coast Salish Weaving_ showcases both historical and contemporary woven items, including blankets, tunics, hoods, and skirts.****

Journey through the seasonal cycle of weaving, from gathering materials and spinning wool to dyeing with natural ingredients and weaving intricate designs.

Along the way, learn firsthand from weavers and gain insight into the deep cultural and scientific knowledge embedded in every strand. 

**[Learn more](/exhibits/woven-wool-resilience-coast-salish-weaving)**
